programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of topical debate.

programme.title: Steeltown Murders S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: DCI Paul Bethell reinvestigates three murders from 1973.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip (Conegliano) S1 (15/15)
programme.desc: «Conegliano»Clive heads to the foothills of the Alps to track down the world's best prosecco.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The market town of Leominster is the destination for today's show. Guiding the teams around an antiques centre in the Herefordshire town are Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell, but which team will make the biggest profit or the smallest loss at auction? Meanwhile, presenter Eric Knowles visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library, where the books are kept under lock and key.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall S3 (10/15)
programme.desc: Rick discovers a brain-boosting mushroom, which he promptly puts in a delicious stir fry.

programme.title: Banjo: Designing the Hebrides (Book Shop) S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: «Book Shop»Banjo heads to the Isle of Skye to redesign an out-of-date café and bookshop.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The big political issues of the day.

programme.title: Impossible S6
programme.desc: Game show presented by Rick Edwards in which players score points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day. In each episode there are three rounds, and the three highest scorers from each round play against each other in the final. The winner of this battle faces a £10,000 question.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Britain is not just our home, it is also our larder. Chef James Martin takes to the skies to explore how the beautiful and unique landscape of the British Isles produces distinct and delicious regional ingredients. He explores the sunny south east to find out why Kent's cherries are so sweet and why his favourite flat fish thrives in the shallow warm waters of the south coast. During his journey, he cooks Hastings Dover sole and a deeply decadent Kentish cherry trifle.

programme.title: A Countryside Summer S1 (1/15)
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher takes to the great outdoors on a bike-packing adventure.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less? S6
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help the Drew family tackle their picky palates.

programme.title: Mission déco S3 (6/8)
programme.desc: The final four designers renovate two cafes in the seaside town of Margate.

programme.title: Flog It ! S14
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of interesting and previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, the Bowes Museum in County Durham, the Grand Pier in Weston-super-Mare in Somerset and Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk. Antiques experts include Kate Bateman, Paul Laidlaw, Jonathan Pratt, James Lewis and Thomas Plant, with items ranging from a pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector. Plus Paul takes a tour around Powis Castle in Wales, finding out about their collection of Indian artefacts housed on site in the Clive Museum.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games wheelie luggage, or will they be tempted by the House of Games reusable coffee mug, which is brand new for this series?

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys (Douglas to Port Erin) S2 (1/20)
programme.desc: «Douglas to Port Erin»Michael Portillo begins on another railway adventure across and beyond the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers (A River of Invention) S1 (4/6)
programme.desc: «A River of Invention»The River Nith in Scotland's south west is the destination for Paul's river grand tour.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift review some of the 35 inspirational gardens on offer, as well as the immaculate displays of growers in the Great Pavilion. Adam Frost delves into a garden created with community in mind, while Arit Anderson heads to the ingenious houseplant studios. Frances Tophill takes a first look at the planting styles to look out for at the show, while Carol Klein gets us in the mood for summer with beautiful blooms. And Sophie Raworth is on hand to welcome the royal family to the show.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the series semi-finals, Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time Northern Ireland (It Wasn't Like a Movie Anymore) S1 (1/5)
programme.desc: «It Wasn't Like a Movie Anymore»When tensions between Protestants and Catholics explode, the British Army is deployed.

programme.title: QI XS S2
programme.desc: A selection of classic clips from QI with travel in mind.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.
